Articles.Content:
I have noticed that lots of people are complaining about extreme lag, and when asked for specs, they are on a laptop. Expecting Ksp to work on a laptop is like complaining that you Ps2 game won't work on your Xbox 360. So, what are you on?

Edit:I am on a laptop, and have so how managed to put up with extreme lag.

Edited May 12, 2013 by lobsterbark
Gaming desktop.

Gaming desktop.

You got your gaming computer done?
Uh yeah..?

Playing on a laptop (specifically, a Samsung R580) and everything's fine with low settings and other stuff. But would sometimes lag as hell though.

Also, it depends on what laptop one is using, and its specs.

A laptop that I recently added 4 gigs of RAM to. Finally got a few issues straightened out, and I am quite happy with all 8 gigs working properly. Being relatively used to the low frames has come in handy more than once.

Uh yeah..?

I saw your computer building thread, before the Great Forum Murderlization. You needed your old avatar back.
I have a laptop with an i5, and I get like 45 - 60 fps.
I play KSP on the most recent MacBook Pro and i am still surprised of how good it works.
Laptop with i7 and nVidia GeForce GT 330M 1GB graphics... and 4GB RAM

I used to play on a laptop back when there was only the Mun, but after burning my leg with the overheating and with the need for a replacement desktop I bit the bullet and bought a fairly good entry level gaming PC
I play on a MacBook Pro with an i7 processor and 8gb of ram game runs like a charm on high settings.

Megatherion

Cpu: intel i5 2500k

Main: Asus p8H67-M LE Rev 3 (incl. SATA III)

RAM: DDR 3 8GB

HDD: SSD 120 GB, 3,5" 1TB

Graphics: GTX 560 Ti

Periphery: Cardreader, USB 3,0

I've been pretty economic prise wise, even with the upgraded cooling he came in about 800Ã¢â€šÂ¬ last year. And all my ahnd selected parts work like a charm together.
I do happen to play on a Mac. Somehow, I'm not lagged by KSP.
I play on a laptop because i want to take KSP with me.
Laptop .
Gaming Desktop

A Laptop with Integrated Graphics, and a old Desktop with intel 3000 graphics.

I'm going to be building a Modest gaming PC this summer though.
I'm on a laptop. Lag is noticeable, but only a problem when launching my larger vehicles, and I'm generally a patient guy.

So far, Leonov is wrong. He predicted that at least 70% would be using a laptop. Or something like that.

Edited May 13, 2013 by lobsterbark

I've been playing KSP on a laptop, but it doesn't meet the recommended specs...

I get 1 fps every time I load up a craft in the world.
I choice other because my desktop is not crappy, not gaming desktop it's STATE OF ART DESKTOP!!!

Some complaints about the poll.

You should use unbiased phrase. People dont want to openly admit their computer is crappy.

Ok and gaming are two seperate topics, as Gaming rigs are purpose built(Usually) and a "ok" compy would be most pre-builts.

Other is silly.
